certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

recyclable_percentage_description: Any timber machinist in Australia is able to re-machine into new products.
recyclable_offcuts_description: Our timber offcuts can be used for even the smallest of items such as gold tee's to avoid sending offcuts to landfill.
recycled_content_description: Our timber fibers are UPCYCLED from low-value resources and we have a yield of more than double that of traditional timber.
recycling_process_description: Our timbers can be re-machined into endless possible applications. Any timber machinist in Australia is able to re-machine into new products.
reusable_description: Our timbers can be re-machined into endless possible applications
end_of_life_program_description: Our timbers are suitable for use by the recycled timber industry or any other person looking for recycled materials.
minimisation_design_strategy: Our billets can be machined into many different items. We encourage engagement with our personnel as we desire to find solutions to minimise offcuts or wastage by looking across multiple applications.

detailed_certifications.certification: Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification

applied_finish_required_description: Standard timber finishes and stains are suitable for timbers. We recommend following coating guidelines and maintenance for specific applications are followed to ensure longevity of timbers.
type_of_packaging: We use a recyclable plastic wrap to protect our raw timbers from moisture during transport.

product_description: The original performance louvre window by Safetyline Jalousie
standard_dimensions: Custom made - up to 1400m wide, louvre blades 135mm intervals
recyclable_percentage_description: The aluminium, glass, and stainless steel components used in Safetyline Jalousie louvre windows are all recyclable through existing Australian recycling infrastructure. The systemâs design allows for easy disassembly, ensuring materials can be separated and diverted from landfill.
recyclable_offcuts_description:
offcuts are either reused or recycled to avoid landfill.
Wherever possible, aluminium and glass offcuts are repurposed in the production of other windows or used for samples. Safetyline Jalousie also has a comprehensive recycling plan in place at our facility, ensuring all aluminium, glass, metal components, and packaging materials are sorted and sent to appropriate recycling streams.
recycled_content_description: Through the use of Hydro Circal 75R Recycled, Low Carbon Aluminium for Framing
recycling_process_description: Safetyline Jalousie louvre windows can be disassembled into aluminium, glass, and stainless steel components. These materials can either be reused or reprocessed â for example, aluminium can be remelted and returned to its original raw state, supporting closed-loop recycling.
reusable_description:
Yes, Safetyline Jalousie louvre windows are designed for demountability and reuse.
The prefabricated system can be removed and reused where appropriate. If full reuse isn't possible, the main components â aluminium framing, glass, and stainless steel fixings â can be separated and recycled at end-of-life, supporting circular economy outcomes.
minimisation_design_strategy:
To minimise offcuts and material wastage, we recommend aligning window set-outs with our standard louvre module sizes.
Safetyline Jalousie louvre windows are prefabricated to order, so optimising the opening dimensions to suit our standard blade lengths and frame configurations helps reduce cutting and waste during production. Early engagement with our team during the design phase also ensures more efficient manufacturing and better material yield.
factory_finished_description: No assembly required - Supplied as a complete system, framed and glazed. Easy and fast installation using screws through the prepunched fixing holes in the upright sections.

manufacturing_locations.component: Cutting, punching, glazing & assembly of the louvre window system

applied_finish_required_description: The aluminium components are available in three surface finishes  - powder coat, high-performance powder coated, or anodised.
other_comments:
There are several features of SJ Jalousie louvre windows that contribute to human health, climate resilience, and circularity.

Durability & longevity: Manufactured with stainless steel fixings and low-carbon aluminium (Hydro CIRCAL or REDUXA), SJ Jalousie is designed for long-term performance, even in demanding environments such as coastal or cyclone-prone areas.

Health & performance: The system promotes natural ventilation and daylight to enhance indoor environmental quality, while its airtightness and weather resistance support energy efficiency and occupant comfort.

Safety & security: With built-in safety features and secure design, SJ Jalousie suits a wide range of applications â from residential to commercial and government projects.

Circularity: The product is fully demountable, and all primary components can be separated and recycled through established onshore recycling facilities.

Local manufacturing: Assembled in Australia under ethical conditions, reducing embodied emissions and supporting the local economy.
type_of_packaging: The louvre units are packed on recycled (and re-usable) timber pine pallets with recycled stretch wrap made with 25% post-consumer resin and certified recyled contend (which is also 100% thin-film recyclable.

product_description: Thermally Broken Large Format Louvre System
standard_dimensions: Custom made  - up to 1500mm wide, louvre blades 235mm intervals
recyclable_percentage_description: The aluminium, glass, and stainless steel components used in Safetyline Jalousie louvre windows are all recyclable through existing Australian recycling infrastructure. The systemâs design allows for easy disassembly, ensuring materials can be separated and diverted from landfill.
recycled_content_description: Frame is constructed from Hydro CIRCAL 75R aluminium made from a minium of 75% post-consumer aluminium scrap.
recycling_process_description: Safetyline Jalousie louvre windows can be disassembled into aluminium, glass, and stainless steel components. These materials can either be reused or reprocessed â for example, aluminium can be remelted and returned to its original raw state, supporting closed-loop recycling.
reusable_description: Yes, Safetyline Jalousies SJ Espacer louvre windows are designed for demountability and reuse. The prefabricated system can be removed and reused where appropriate. If full reuse isn't possible, the main components â aluminium framing, glass, and stainless steel fixings â can be separated and recycled at end-of-life, supporting circular economy outcomes.
minimisation_design_strategy: To minimise offcuts and material wastage, we recommend aligning window set-outs with our standard louvre module sizes. Safetyline Jalousie louvre windows are prefabricated to order, so optimising the opening dimensions to suit our standard blade lengths and frame configurations helps reduce cutting and waste during production. Early engagement with our team during the design phase also ensures more efficient manufacturing and better material yield.
factory_finished_description: No assembly required - Supplied as a complete system, framed and glazed.

manufacturing_locations.component: Cutting, punching, glazing & assembly of the louvre window system

applied_finish_required_description: The aluminium components are available in three surface finishes  - Powder coated, high performance powder coated or anodized
other_comments: The SJ Espacer supports human health by maximising natural ventilation and daylight, reducing reliance on mechanical systems. Its frame is manufactured using Hydro CIRCAL, a low-carbon aluminium made from a minimum of 75% recycled post-consumer scrap, significantly lowering embodied emissions. Designed and assembled in Australia, the system promotes local jobs and supply chain transparency. Prefabrication minimises waste and enables circularity through easier disassembly and material recovery at end-of-life.
type_of_packaging: The louvre units are packed on recycled (and re-usable) timber pine pallets with recycled stretch wrap made with 25% post-consumer resin and certified recyled contend (which is also 100% thin-film recyclable.

product_description: Metallised 4% openness fabric with high solar reflectance and thermal insulation
recyclable_percentage_description:
95-100%- 
We recycled all of our 205 SilverScreen performance off-cuts via in-house sampling, and remaining or returned fabrics via take-back program are recycled via conversion into alternate fuels for industry
reusable_description: The fabric can be reused and or recycled
end_of_life_program_description: Verosol have a product stewardship and take-back program
minimisation_design_strategy: Manufactured into custom widths to avoid wastage
risk_of_harm_posed_description:
95-100%
We recycled all of our Crypton offcuts and sampling by partnering with Textile Recyclers Group at their recycling depot in Sydney. They recycle back into yarn.
other_comments:
Verosolâs approach to Product Stewardship is comprehensive. It includes minimising the carbon footprints of all our offices and 
manufacturing facilities; the development of a Product Take Back Program; a Waste to Energy Program; Waste Recycling Programs 
at our facilities in the Netherlands and Australia; regulatory compliance in all countries in which we operate; responsible sourcing 
of materials; and concerted efforts in terms of Material Re-Use and Product Conversion.
i) Carbon Footprint Reduction
Acknowledging the significant contribution that poor manufacturing practices can make to greenhouse emissions, we make every 
effort to ensure our manufacturing facilities in Australia and the Netherlands are as efficient as possible. Our efforts to reduce 
operational carbon include the installation of rooftop solar cells at our plants in Sydney and The Netherlands, and the installation 
of LED lighting in our Sydney plant and office..
Our Australian production facility in 2023, has moved beyond climate neutral goals becoming carbon positive with the expansion
of the existing solar panel system. The facility now produces a large surplus of renewable energy, offsetting more energy than the
site consumes.
For more information visit: https://verosol.com.au/product-stewardship/
type_of_packaging: 100% recycled cardboard cores and clear plastic wrap. Pallets and cardboard boxes are used for large volumes
